questions.question: The High Court ………………………. the decree of the lower court.
questions.description: To set a law aside is to annul it.

questions.question: I was determined to ………………………
questions.description: To speak out is to express your opinion freely.

questions.question: He always …………………………… the weak and the oppressed.
questions.description: To stand up for something / somebody is to champion the cause of it / them.

questions.question: I can no longer ……………………….. your insolence.
questions.description: To put up with something is to tolerate it.

questions.question: He was …………………………. when I refused his offer.
questions.description: Be put out can mean annoyed or vexed.

questions.question: It didn’t take him too long to ………………………. his fortune.
questions.description: To run through fortune is to squander it away.

questions.question: In his speech on tolerance, he ………………………… his views at length.
questions.description: To set forth your views is to explain it clearly.

questions.question: I could easily ………………………….. his trick.
questions.description: To see through something is to detect the true nature of.

questions.question: Monsoon in India ………………………….. about June.
questions.description: When a season sets in, it begins.

questions.question: We shall be formidable if we ………………………… one another.
questions.description: To stand by somebody is to support them.
